intro: Phyteuma scheuchzeri var. michelii, commonly known as the Alpine bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to cold climates. This variety is closely related to other members of the Campanulaceae family, sharing similar floral structures and growth habits.
